review: I can't for the life of me figure out what people like about Red Robin.  Ok, so my hamburger was reasonably good and so were the fries.  But they cost 10!  This place is noisy and crowded and full of screaming kids.

A Red Robin is a Red Robin-pretty damn tasty food (bottom steak fries, yeah!) for a decent price. What makes this particular location above average is the service. I popped in here on a drive to Vegas with my mom and sister for a lunch that would give us some time to eat and relax, but not keep us long. Our server was fantastic. She took my 10% off check in deal with no problem and was super friendly, and made sure she had everything right. She checked in the perfect amount, making sure we had what we needed and that everything tasted OK. She was even nice enough to get my mom a club soda for the road. I really like the food here, and the service was top notch. The next time I'm driving through Saint George, I'll be stopping in again.

Love the food, ambience is fun, service is poor and sometimes adequate. The past four times I have been there they forget some part of the meal! One time the appetizer came after the main course!!   So, be patient if you go.  The upside is you will get to know the manager well, as he will come and apologize and give you something for free.

even though the waitress spilled a drink on my sister she was very gracious and kind and the service was still excellent. atmosphere is bright and fun. pricing seems reasonable. food was tasty and brought to the table warm. drinks were Kept filled and she even offered us a to-go cup. I would recommend red robin to anyone.

Been a while since we tried Red Robin.  I remember I enjoyed the onion rings when we came then.  The menu looks pretty much the same as any burger place, but they do have some interesting combinations.  I thought I'd try the southwest chili burger they had been advertising as a special.  It didn't come looking like the picture, it was smaller, and didn't look appealing, but the burger was juicy. It came with never ending fries and well, one serving was enough.  Overall, service was good, I enjoyed the burger, not the additions.  Perhaps I need to try a different burger?
The service is really good . Mitch was great and very helpful . The food was only ok, it is . I had the fry fish and was tasteless.  Very spacious and clean . I got 10% discount with my yelp check in

We have eaten at Red Robin several times and had a pleasant experience. But this last time will be the last time.  We were seated promptly. But our service was a joke. Nicky or server seemed to have no interest in helping us she refilled or drinks but we had to ask another server for more fries. We got those refilled once and I was threw.  Next time I will go to Carls Jr. We'd I can get the same meal for half the price and if you are treated like crap there you expect it.
Good burger and better atmosphere service was great.

The food, the atmosphere, and the decor at Red Robin is always excellent. They also have excellent service. The people that work there are always friendly and the place is always clean. I love their salted caramel shake, the bottomless fries, and their burgers. My mom loves their Chicken Tortilla Soup and Wraps. I definitely recommend this place.

We stopped here to grab lunch in between my wedding and reception. We chose it last minute and were in our wedding attire (yes, I was in my Dress). They Promptly seated us, made sure my booth was clean, and gave us a nice corner that fit our large group. They were so helpful and kind to us during our meal. The staff was friendly and on top of things. Our Burgers were absolutely delicious! I got the mushroom burger and my husband got the guacamole burger. Both were very well made.  To top off our amazing service, they brought us out dessert and had beautifully written congrats on the plate with chocolate and strawberry sauce. It was so thoughtful and we were excited! That is not the only time I have been to this location. They never disappoint. The food is good, the place is clean, and the staff is great. I highly recommend this place!

We dropped our car off at Discount Tire and it wouldn't be ready for an hour, so hubby and I decided to see what was nearby to grub on. This Red Robin is right next to Discount Tire so we decided to just eat here. Walking in we were greeted and taken to a booth, menus were brought and drink orders were taken.   Looking over the menu there was a lot of options at reasonable prices. I ordered a cup of "French Onion Soup" priced at $3 and a "Mini Wedge Salad" priced at $3 as well. I asked for the salad first and the soup for my meal. The salad came pretty quick and looked great. The mini wedge salad had a chunk of crisp lettuce that made the perfect bed for the blue cheese crumbles, bacon, tomatoes, crispy onion straws and dressing. For $3 this salad is a winner. The French onion soup was a whole other story. When our server, Angela, brought out hubbys burger she didn't have my soup. She said that they had to make a new batch of soup and it should be right out. Well, hubby ate his whole meal and I still had no soup. I watched as Angela waited at the kitchen and kept asking them if it was ready yet. Finally I saw someone walk over and pull my soup down from under what appeared to be a heated lamp. The cheese on top of the soup appeared to be overcooked (probably from sitting under a light for too long) and the cheese was so melted/hardened to the cup that is just wasn't good. The soup however did taste good. It was filled with many onions and the broth has a good flavor. They had the usual bread in the soup (that bread was good) and a rock hard piece of bread on the side of my cup was not necessary. Hubby enjoyed his burger. Many of the burgers come with bottomless fries! So, with your first check-in on yelp this location offers 10% off your total bill. Just make sure and check your receipt to make sure you get it! I showed the offer to our server, who then took my phone over to her manager for approval. She came back to the table with my phone and said it would be applied before she brought the bill. Because of the issue with how long it took to get my french onion soup they said the soup would be taken off of the bill. They still put it on the bill, but as a substitute for the bottomless french fries that came with hubbys burger and charged $ 1.79 for it! WTH?!?!?! I was told that since it was already rung up they couldn't do anything. Really?? I really enjoyed our server and a majority of my meal, but with the soup fiasco and not honoring the discount, I could not give this place any higher of a rating and feel generous giving 3. The total w/o discount and being charged for the soup was $15.42 so I couldn't see arguing about a 10% discount. Not too many times can you to go into a restaurant where 2 people eat for that cheap. ***UPDATE*** After receiving my e-mail as well reading my review on yelp, Dan, the manager for this Red Robin location reached out to me by phone (gave my number in the e-mail) immediately. He remembered my husband and myself and said that the server should have told him about the yelp discount not being on the check as well the french onion soup. He said that my soup wasn't to his standard or mine. He said he appreciated my honest review and that he really cared about us coming back in the future. I let Dan know that it meant a lot to me that he would reach out and talk to me about my experience and that hubby and I would for sure be back when passing through town again.  I want to leave my original review because it was still an experience that did happen, but wanted to make the immediate update about why I changed my rating to 4 stars and that the manager did reach out to make things right. I hope everyone will give this Red Robin location a try!

I'm surprised I haven't eaten at Red Robin until now. If you love burgers this a good spot. I ordered the Burnin' Love burger that cost just over $10 and came with bottomless fries. The burger had fried jalapeno, salsa, pepper jack cheese, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeno-cornmeal kaiser roll. This burger had awesome flavor and was a good size. The fires were huge and cooked just right. I did go for another round of fries and think it is a cool deal how you can keep them coming fresh and hot. My wife had a salad that was presented well and she enjoyed it very much. When it came time for her main course that was different. I finished my whole meal before she got hers and when she did it was overcooked. We also noticed when checking in on yelp that you can get 10 percent off your meal. Our server said it wouldn't be a problem yet we weren't given the discount. The server said since it was already rung up it can't be changed. My wife's meal was also supposed to be removed from the bill for it being overcooked and served so late yet it was on the bill. After writing her review the manager reached out to her and said our visit wasn't up to his standard and intended to make things right. I was hesitant to come back to this Red Robin because of feeling like I was getting taken by them when it comes to the bill, but because the manager reached out and seemed sincere, I would give this location another shot. The food was good and the menu prices are fair.

The service was extremely slow but the food was good. I had the Royal Robin burger and it was good. The fries are bottomless but by the time my second order came we were ready to leave. They have a variety of dipping sauces available for your fries. The one with bacon in it is really good. Even though services was slow, I love the food and will come back.

I have to say I wasn't expecting much given the previous reviews but was pleasantly surprised. Food was as it should be .. Just as good as other locations. Service was outstanding!! Chase was our server and super attentive and efficient.

The waitress, Sharon, was great!  They need new cooks that actually care about what they're doing.  I eat at Red Robins all over the place and I'm usually very happy with everything.  The cooks here are a total disappointment.  The food was OK at best.  The fries were mangled into the little metal holder.  There were 3 fries that actually looked like fries that were edible.  No one should pay these prices for food like that. Get new cooks ASAP!

I've been here multiple times (not this location, but others) and it is a decent burger place. It definitely is not my favorite burger, but it has a good variety of burgers. However, I ordered the fish and chips and they were horrible. I was definitely disappointed. So... don't order anything that isn't a burger here.

Been to this location several times for both lunch and dinner. Service and food is always up to par. On the weekends and peak dinners times the wait can be long. Just heads up. Overall it's pretty good.

If you want to read a review from an employee... continue reading. I applied to work here in 2012 because my wife and I were having our first baby and I wanted to pay off medical bills. I was embarrassed to have to wait tables as a second job. I can say, after 2 years here, I love it! I feel like the staff here really enjoys their job. The managers all treat the employees fairly which in turn makes a great guest experience. If you are ever unhappy talk to a manager or your waiter, we care and want to make it right for you! During my time as employee here I have to say I've never, not once, seen anything that concerned me as far as food, quality or service. These are standards that are extremely important to the restaurant.  Salads - huge portions, great value, fresh and quality. Burgers - great variety (I still haven't tried 'em all). Try the Royal Red Robin, Guacamole they are great. Seafood - we are actually known to have great fish. Ive tried it and I really like it. We have people come in ALL THE TIME for fish and chips! Everything else - rarely do we have stuff that I don't recommend. Ask your servers we will help.  Come Visit SOON! (and ask for John if its a Saturday night!)

Although service can be spotty we think the burgers are very tasty and the salads  are generous and fresh.  Love that they offer to go cups for beverages you have not finished.  Best to arrive between 3 and 5 pm if you are in a hurry and don't like crowds.

We were disappointed with our experience at this location. First of all I have to say that our server was pleasant however when our main dish arrived, it wasn't what we ordered. We both ordered Patty Melts, hers with Blue Cheese and mine with Swiss. What we got was both had Blue Cheese and Swiss on them. My wife also ordered the garlic fries but the plate had regular fries. Upon delivering them, the server said " Oh you need Garlic Fries". She did bring them eventually. Food was mediocre at best! When the bill came, we were overcharged. We will not go back to this location!

Yeah, I had the royal red robin burger and it was great! The assembly of the burger was well done. It looked as good as the picture. The fries were great, the service was great, but the peach shake was a bit disappointing. I really loved the meal overall.

This Red Robin is completely understaffed. Only two waitresses, taking orders, plating at the station, and taking care of the bill. The food is nothing like the pictures as advertised on their menu. The so called Cod was horrible, it took for ever to get a waitress to show up before and after dinner. Will never go there again.
Loved the Yelp check in discount! Service is sub par. Food was decent for the price. Also people in kitchen have beards and don't use hair nets on them!

The hostess had a cold.  I feel restaurants should send sick people home.  The service was good. New review.  This time the service was lacking.  They seemed under staffed.  The food was still decent.
I wanted more milkshake and they didn't give me more milkshake! Also the glasses are deceiving. Looks like a lot but is nearly nothing! ~ Bratty Kid
3pm on a Saturday. One hour before getting food. There are a bunch of tables open even. Awful service. No refills. Servers name is Angell.

I have been here several times. Each time the service is getting worse. The meals are taking longer to get out. This time they lost our order and had to resubmit the order. Had to take our empty drink glasses and find another waitress to get refills. On the up side, the manager took care of the food portion of the bill. I will say the food has always been good.

I love Red Robin. Well, at least the ones in California. Came here on a Saturday afternoon, party of 6, seated right away and drink orders were taken almost immediately. Once our food order was taken, the waitress was gone for over 20 minutes. I noticed that she was the only waitress and she was hustling. So it's not her fault that the place was under staffed. Despite ordering my burger at a medium temp, it arrived well done. The cheeseburger had a tart sauce that was not listed as an ingredient on the menu. If I would have known about it, I would have opted for it not to be added to my burger. It was just nasty. Even my sister in-law didn't like the taste. Bottomless fries refills weren't as "bottomless" as they are in California.  The place was clean. The restroom was "ok" - could've been cleaner.  There is a 10% off coupon when you check into Yelp. The waitress had no idea what we were talking about and required the manager to take a look. Fortunately, the coup was accepted, but overall, this visit was quite a disappointment.

I used to be a big fan of Red Robin but within the past year the quality of their food has greatly decreased, especially their grilled chicken. The chicken has a rubbery texture and taste. This will be the last time I eat there. The service was friendly and fast.

Took over 45 min to get our food and there was only my hubby and I and our two kids! The food is not worth the wait! We watch as people who came after we ordered got their food before us! Our server told us twice that our food would be right out. Come on! Just a big disappointment.

UPDATE: Went back Red Robin's with a gift certificate (thank you) a little hesitant from our last experience. Long story short today was great, the food was as good as we were used to and service from Mandy was on point. Good job Red Robin we will he back sooner than later. ++++++++++ Came in, place is semi busy with waiting around 5 mins not too bad.  Shortly after 6 of us were packed into a 4 person booth, no biggie. We only saw our waitress when she took the order and when she left the check. Terrible service, food was subpar with what Im used to at RR. Disappointed but will be back in the future tentatively. Red Robin's customer service reached out and gave a partial voucher. Ill let y'all know how it goes.

I've had some great experiences at other Red Robin restaurants, but this one was quite disappointing. I ordered the Big Tavern (which looks delicious on the menu, and HUGE) and I was told by the waiter that it is a 1/2 pound patty. I also requested that it be cooked medium rare. The burger came out looking about like a 1/4 pound patty, maybe smaller, overcooked, and topped with Kraft Singles-like cheese. Bummer.

Our ONLY negative dining experience while visiting Utah.  The food was fine....it's a Red Robin.  The service was disappointing to say the least.  The first table we were seated at rocked and spun every time you touched it, so we asked if we could move to the booth right next to it.  We were seated there, and then waited, waited, waited.....before our server arrived.  She took our drink order and then we waited another ten minutes before she returned to take our order.  Then more waiting and waiting and waiting....I saw two of our three dishes come up in the kitchen, they both sat there for almost ten minutes before the third one (a salad) came up and we finally got our food.  The server brought our check out and then disappeared!  We waited and waited and waited again before a manager finally noticed we were waiting to pay and came to ring us out.  I would have been a little more understanding had the place been busy but it was a very average late lunch crowd.   Would not dine here unless you have a lot of time to kill.

We like the menu at Red Robin, but we won't be back.  Stopped in for lunch at around 2 PM.  No one seated us so we waited, waited and waited some more, even though two guys who looked like manager level employees walked past us several times.  Finally, we asked if we could sit in the bar.  "Okay," said the one "manager" when he walked past us again.  So we sat in the bar and waited and waited and waited, no one came by.  So we left.  There appears to be an attitude problem at this Red Robin.  Maybe corporate should review and make changes?? I'm just sayin'.
Super friendly service and the very berry lime aid was superb, couldn't really say the same for the food...

What a pleasant surprise I had at this Red Robin. I have eaten here before and they were ok, but they were noisy, slow and the endless fries meant an endless wait, so much so that we left as they arrived. Not so this trip. Our server was Mandy. She was very attentive. She knew just when to show up without being overly so. She brought us fries while we waited because they screwed up my special needs request. I can't eat to,auto products and the relish they use has it in it! Who knew! But they figured it out and fixed it by totally redoing the order so it was fresh and hot. We asked for more fries and received two large orders, not the one old stale thing we expected and it was there Johnny on the spot! The other staff was friendly also. I dropped my napping and someone jumped right in, picked it up and brought me a new one (several actually). Mandy helped us through the new pay screen tablet at the tables. I absolutely recommend them. I didn't get a picture as I was too busy eating!
Service good / food bad. Crappy stale fries, tough chicken n lousy taste. Go elsewhere.
Once again after a long Red Robin absence as they closed the one near us. The gourmet burger delivered as usual and fries were great. Don' t change what your doing.
We have never been disappointed. The employees are friendly, knowledgeable and prompt. The food is always fresh and tasty.

So this is an update from my last review. Red robin got in contact with me and apologized for my bad experience. They had me come back in and gave me my meal for free. The customer service was very good and they were very polite. This time around the food was very good. I was a little bugged that they charged me extra to put something on my burger and forgot to put it. Other then that it was a good experience.

Cold food and the service was lousy.. I don't think that I would recommend this place to anyone. I have been to other red robins in California and it was much better. Save your time and go to the habit or in and out.

Expensive hamburger but it's okay and the fries are good.  But the service has always been decent until yesterday 1/7/16.  We came in, were seated, and then ignored for almost 20 minutes even after we finally pushed the call waiter button, and so we left.  It wasn't busy, the girl who seated us was wandering around filling water glasses, and as we left ,there were some other girls standing around the cash register gabbing and one barely said something like Thanks for Coming without even looking up.  It was ridiculous.  Don't they have a manager, or was he off fooling around somewhere, too?  We have no desire to go back.  There are plenty of hamburger places in town.
Average Red Robin food with endless fries but the service at this one was a little slow.   As an example,  e didn't get silverware until after the food came out.

I haven't been to Red Robin in some time. The iPad's at the tables were disappointing. I know we are coming to that time but.. where is good customer service. If you expect a tip then I want you to process my entire order and bring me my check with a smile. The burgers sucked. I could of went to In N Out and paid a quarter of what I paid,  for a better burger.

This Red Robin is great and I've gone here with family and friends for years and it has always had great food and service. Unfortunately, the last two times we've been as a family(in the last two months), the food and service has been great, but they were clearly understaffed. Our servers were great. Very friendly and professional, but running so much to so many tables that we waited much longer for refills, check ins etc. Tonight there were several empty tables around us, but the staff was running like ants on an anthill....just not many ants were there.  As an example, I ordered the bottomless rootbeer float as my drink. I had it emptied completely even before finishing our appetizer and asked for a refill. We got our food, I ate all my food (double tavern burger and bottomless fries) my wife finished her meal, my kids all but finished their meals, I was paying the bill on our table kiosk when our server finally got back with my rootbeer float refill. Our server was great in every way and was never standing still (I watched him going to several other tables delivering food, etc. etc.), but by the time he got back to us, we were nearly done with our meal.  I noticed it was the same for other tables and servers. Something to keep in mind on the next visit.  The new decor inside is awesome. Nice renovation!  Still high marks for this Red Robin.

I have to update my review. Red robin listened to my Complaints to corporate (at least I like to think they did) and the garlic fries are back!!!!  The service still sucked that day, and I often go there when they won't seat my party even though there are tons of open tables because they are understaffed, but garlic fries !!

I always come here when I'm craving burgers and they never let me down. I usually order the prime chophouse burger  and a strawberry milkshake!! Add that with the unlimited crispy fries and how can you say no?!?!  also, the service has definitely improved since they inputted the new machines at your table that allows you to pay without waiting for a waiter to bring you the check.

Had a great meal, drinks and service in the bar! The host Hali was great! Our server was Kyle and it was some of the best service I've had in years! The food was extremely fast. Totally recommend this place!

My friend and I came here for lunch today. We have both worked in the service industry before and we were very impressed with our server, Cody. He had a fun personality and was so sweet!  I have had some mediocre service lately so I would come back just to request him for a pleasant dining experience! I didn't catch the name of the host. He was young and had dark hair and braces, early college age maybe. He was also very inviting and friendly. Great job to Red Robin for hiring such a great staff! I got the soup and salad combo and I thought it was really tasty! Keep it up, Red Robin!

Restaurant is clean.  Service is terrible at this location.  I have been to various Red Robin restaurants with great results and have been very happy.  I have been to this location now, 4 times with terrible service each and every time.  I will not go back.  Service is slow, orders not taken accurately or completely, only half of the order delivered, items forgotten, drinks not refilled for kids, only adults.  These have been our complaint each and every time at this location.  There is an "In and Out" location a couple of blocks away.  It would be as much better choice that this specific Red Robin location.

While the food is still tasty, the service this time was terrible! Our waitress took about 10 minutes to get our drink order. And another 10 to bring it to us. After giving us our drinks she said she'd be right back to take our order... Another 10 minutes go by. She took our order, refilled our drinks about 10 minutes after taking our order. Our food came out fairly quick. She didn't check up on us at all during our meal. And because I had a 10% off discount for checking in on yelp, we had to flag her down before we could pay our tab so we could get our discount. We spent over an hour here and not by choice! And she can't even use the excuse it was busy because we went in for an early dinner at 4:45pm and there were only about 10 tables with people and it looked as if our waitress was only waiting on us and 2 other tables... The other waiter and waitresses had the others.

Went by again tonight. We probably go here once every 8 weeks.  This time the food was just ok. On the table was this machine which you can play trivia and games. I kept looking at it and never saw anywhere that there was a change for playing. We played 1 game and when we got our bill we were charged $2.50 for playing one game.  I think they need to tell you that there is a charge associated with play.
Excellent food and service. All these type of places need to get rid of those table top devices.

I used to like Red Robin and went there frequently with my children. The food was decent and affordable. My kids liked the never ending fries. When they first came out with the garlic fries they were really good and garlicky. Since that first time we have been disappointed in the garlic fries. While being charged more for them, they are basically regular fries with very little garlic, if any. We asked the server for more garlic and it seemed like there was garlic salt on the next batch, but no real garlic. The server asked how the second batch was and seemed inconvenienced that we weren't very pleased. I won't say we'll never go back, but that experience lessened my desire to go there. Not out of protest or anything, but it seemed like they were just going cheap on us and didn't care if we liked it or not.

It was a fantastic family meal. Service was great and attentive.  The only "complaint" was my daughter ordered the "Grilled Cesar Side Salad". She thought she had ordered a Grilled CHICKEN Cesar side salad and told the rest of us the same.  When it came out, we all laughed so hard because it came as two romaine stalks that were grilled then the Cesar Dressing was dabbed on top. BTW it was EXACTLY what the menu said! It was delicious!
Great Service sat at the bar, the bar tender Dylan was fantastic at best .... Good Job

First off my family and I love red robin, we are from las vegas and just recently moved to the St. George area. This location absolutely ruined the experience for us. We arrived at 6:57pm and waited at least 40 minutes before being seated, the greeter apparently forgot about us when we were sitting in front of him the whole time. At least 4 other groups that came in after us were seated before us. When we were walking towards our table we noticed that there were more than 8 other tables available. Once seated we ordered right away and waited another 15 minutes for our drinks. Our server was nice and brought us our bottomless fries while we waited for our food, and thats the last time we saw her, even after asking for ketchup and her saying she would be back with it. We waited up until 8:45 and my pregnant wife decided it was time to go because of the ridiculous wait time and noticing everyone that had came in before and after us had food on their tables and the horrible service at this location. My family left outside and i waited at the front to at least pay for the drinks and fries. Even after that whole fiasco i was made to wait another 10 minutes for a different server to come out and tell me they'll take care of the drinks and had the audacity to say that our food wasn't even on the grill anyways so they wouldn't make me pay for the food and when i asked where our server was she magically disappeared and wasn't there. In total we were there a little over 2 hours. We don't like causing problems and certainly don't want anything for free when We're able to pay for it, but our first and only experience at this location was a joke. My family and I will not come near this location ever again because of this, we'll just have to travel back to las vegas if we want to eat at a red robin again.

Not sure what has happened at this restaurant, but we have had the worst service and bad food the last 3 times we have been here.  Food is either cold or over cooked.  Service is slow and inattentive.  Red Robin, even though it is a chain, used to have heart.  This one just falls flat.  Guess we will scratch another place off our list in St. George.
Ate there 2 nights ago. Not very good . Poor service. Had to ask for things several times if you could find your waiter. Judy V
Definitely hit the spot after a day in the snow. Food here is always delicious! I love how you can play games while you wait for your food.

Here's the short version of my review; if your party is higher than the fingers you have on your hands, don't bother coming here. I don't remember the specific time we checked in, lets say around 6 PM, but our party of 16 were told it would be a half hour to forty five minute wait. This is understandable and acceptable, it isn't often we get to have this much family here in St George and we always love going out on these rare nights so this wasn't our first rodeo. A half an hour goes by and the other table of 16 seated were still eating dinner, so we were told it was another wait. Possibly an hour total. Again, understandable as this is a busy Saturday night in St George. Listening to the host in between talking among ourselves I'd hear "party of 4" "party of 5" etc. They can probably sit in a booth and aren't going to be in a huge table like ours. Again, understandable. Then I noticed a table of nine being called. Then the BAR TENDER, not even the host, decided to come on up and let a party of 11 take the table we had been waiting for this entire time. More high party tables were being seated before us. This was close to the two hour mark. They finally got to seat our party... Of about 6 people. I'm glad we managed to whittle it down for them because I know counting can be very tough when you have the mind of a child in an adult body. Speaking of children it was sad to see my young niece and nephew be so good and wait patiently to get to eat with us be turned away because it was just getting too late for them to stay up. I decided to leave because I wondered if they couldn't even seat our party like any other restaurant is capable of (which we've done many times) how can I trust them to get my order right, to have good service? This place is a joke.

This was our first time at a Red Robin and our last. Our service was decent. The waiter was prompt in refilling our soft drinks and our food order was delivered in a reasonable time. But the second he put my plate on table I was disappointed. My D.G.B. Burger looked nothing like the picture on the menu. The arugula citrus salad on the burger was so skimpy and wilted It was not a good compliment to the large meat patty. The roasted tomatoes were almost nonexistent as was the garlic aioli. The burger tasted like it looked on my plate, blah. The portion of "endless fries" was so small it was shocking and they were cold. On top of that we paid extra for fry sauce that was just a small plastic cup 1/2 full. No more fries for us, thank you. My husband had the gourmet burger he said was okay but definitely not worth the price. We don't mind paying for a great burger but it better be great!

I see all the poor reviews and this will also be our last time there. After 50 minutes of waiting for our food and five other parties, coming after us, ordering, eating and leaving, we asked for a manager to pay our bill for the drinks and leave. Horrible service. Manager really didn't care we were leaving. Based on the reviews below, he is used to it. My only questions are. Why are those people who work there still employed? Why hasn't corporate stepped in?

Haven't been here in over a year. Service still sucks. Their "gourmet" burgers were equal to a quarter pounder at McDonald's. Not hyperbole. Way overpriced. $14 a burger. Skimpy as hell on the fries so their "bottomless" fries are maybe 10 full fries then you have to gun down your waiter/waitress to get a refill which takes 10 or more minutes. I could go on and on but I'm done wasting my time with this place. Trust me. Don't eat here. Complete waste of money and the service Is extremely deplorable. Another place in st george I'll swear off forever.

We ate here twice this week(free dinner cards). Both times we waited almost an hour for our food. I'm not sure if they didn't have enough people working, or if our servers were just slow. Our food was barely warm when it was delivered. Save some money and eat at another place

Stopped in to get dinner with a group of 4 others. The server was very enthusiastic and got our drinks right away. When she took our order she did a great job, but.... When we got our food, two of the burgers were wrong. Well, it was not her fault and she corrected it for us very quickly. The manager Matt came out and apologized for the inconvenience. He was very apologetic and very understanding. Come to find out, it was our servers second day and that there are two burgers that are similar when put into the machine. Matt offered us free dessert and even gave us a $15 gift card for our next visit. Both Matt and our server were very professional about the mistake and very generous for the time that we had no problem whatsoever waiting for.  The food was absolutely fantastic as always and we will most certainly be coming back.

The food is good but the service is absolutely terrible. They take forever and even the manager didn't help us when they asked us if we have been helped yet. Eat somewhere else if you don't want to wait around just to get your drinks ordered

This is the best Red Robin that I've been to. The customer service is always top of the line, everyone is friendly. The food is always hot, great plate presentation, and served in a timely manner. The atmosphere is good and not overly loud.  One of my favorite places when I get to Saint George.

We have eaten at Red Robin many times and enjoyed it. But unfortunately things have gone down hill. Long wait, terrible service and sub par food. "Bottomless" isn't really "bottomless" when you wait so long between refills that you loose your appetite and your patience.
The managers are so welcoming here and walk around to the tables. The environment is awesome and so fun! Definitely a must go to while in St George!

Red Robin is our go to date night, every Friday, unless we're out of town. Best restaurant ever! For those complaining about waiting? Yes, because it's great! That's the reason for large parties, hands on Managers and Servers! As soon as you walk in the door, you are greeted by friendly hosts, placed on list. They ask for your phone number to notify you when your table is available, and seated accordingly--size of party, area...they accommodate your seating wishes, and also need to set up tables to accommodate larger parties, including all the sports teams that frequent this area.  The service is excellent, as well as the extensive menu variety, full bar, balloons for kids, chalkboard which kids and parents love to write on while waiting for tables.  Management is full on track, as well as the servers! The food is freshly cooked, great burgers, salads, fish, full bar varieties.   Seriously, we don't understand the lower than Five-star rating. You won't find any other A-typical restaurant in this popular area, St. George, Washington City. We are regulars, because of very impressive first class service, cleanliness, food and bar service!

Honestly I came in here with low expectations, and I'm not much of a curmudgeon when it comes to food. But the service was awful, the food was cold and undercooked. One of the servers was very kind and helpful and admitted to poor health habits in the kitchen. I appreciate the honesty. Cassidy was another server that was very helpful but she was told to stop helping my group.

How can you not get a burger and milkshake when coming here???   I had a salted caramel milkshake that was very good.  I had it almost all gone before my burger arrived.  I ordered the burger with Mac n cheese on it.  When it arrived, it was steamy hot and looked great.   I must have read the description wrong because the Mac and cheese was so spicy I didn't enjoy it at all.  I ended up scraping it all off, but the damage of the heat was done.  My husband ordered the same thing, which never happens and he felt the same way and he has a much higher tolerance for hot food than I do. Our server was friendly and when we placed our order I told him I was using my Yelp check in 10% off coupon.   He did come around to check on our orders but we had a hard time tracking him down for our check.  When he showed it to me on the screen on our table, there was no discount.  He said he would come back and fix it.  After 15 minutes and no waiter, we paid the full amount and reduced his tip.  Service is so important these days and he didn't live up to easy service.

HORRID service. The waiter had about 15 tables by himself. We'd ask for a fry sauce and 20 minutes later, after our fries are cold, hey, here comes one fry sauce! For a table of 6! This is the third time in a row we've had a crappy experience. With all the choices down here, we won't be going back.

The way the place looks is fine. But the food... is baddddddd. The way the burger came was perfectly grilled and the bun was broiled made the place suck so much. The fries were nice and crispy which was like throwing up and then throwing up again. 2 stars because of the fact that we came back the next day and it was the same old thing bad. 10/9 would eat here next year
Best burgers in town! I never visit St George without stopping in for one of their delicious burgers. The staff is fantastic too. Especially our server Caleb and the Manager John.
Service has been slow the last two times here. If you only have an hour for lunch forget it. They can't seem to find help. The food is great when it finally gets to your table.
Food was ok, the place pretty clean. But the service was outstanding.  Hard to find good customer service in these types of restaurants, but the waitress here was awesome!

We'll, I think as far as the competition, this Restaurant may have a leg up. But that's not saying much, given the lack of quality burger restaurants in the area. Our service this week was okay, but we were told the crew was short-handed on the particular evening we visited. Folks! Get rid of the Ziosk consoles at the tables!!! People prefer good quality service, versus interfacing with a tablet or electronic device. Give it up already! I'm trying to give this place some love, but it's hard to do when your burgers are served raw, the replacements take forever to arrive and the dessert you ordered is stale.  Wait! The tower of onion rings were good. Looking forward to better competition coming to town, in the local "gourmet" burger market.
I have been to many Red Robin locations in California and Nevada, and none of them took care of me better than St. George. Everyone was friendly and upbeat. Food was perfect and fairly fast.
Matt is really one of a kind and is very genuine.  Great person and knows how to run a restaurant.  Keep up the great work son.  See ya soon. Jack Burton

Have it your way doesn't always exist! Having lived here for many years I have heard every excuse under the sun to keep me from getting a burger the way I WANT. Red Robin is flexible. Vegans are welcome. They have turkey burgers, they also have fish! Being so particular I have learned to be courteous and nice before I order. I try to get everyone on my side about how I want my burger (responsibility all mine...triconous too!) cooked. Manager, waitstaff, cook...only if they can do it. If they can't do it my way I will order something else. Amazing when everyone is vested on getting it right.  Praise, smile, and tip when they get it right. We have had a few mediums end up well done (oh boy) and a begged for rare end up too pink (oh no). I give Red Robin 4 stars for stepping up to the challenge and getting it right more often than not. Reading complaints always interest me. Particular, specific diners need to accept some responsibility when ordering...do you want bun toasted? No cold or soggy fries? Want your waitstaff to smile and be good humored? Give a smile. Think through your order before you place it. Be specific. Want something left off? Tell them they are not mind readers. Give staff every opportunity to get it right. Yesterday kids were out of school...this is a very family centered restaurant. No complaint from me. I opted to sit at the bar. Had a great Cod on a bun. Waited with a coffee and basket of fries (endless) while my order was completed.  Cost lunch under $20 (hate the billing, entertainment machine that in reality puts someone out if work under the guise of speeding service...if I wanted speedy service I would fast food it or eat at home...diners are not fooled). The establishment is clean as are servers and restrooms. The plating of food orders is enticing to the taste buds. I was alone, however multiple parties had little or no wait at 1in the afternoon for tables. Noise level was contained with children's voices on the other side of the restaurant. I could still hear the TV and other patrons on the bar side could talk without raising their voices. My bartender server was attentive while still fulfilling drinks for the waitstaff. There were also other patrons eating at the bar. She kept her poise and her smile.  Do join their loyalty club if you enjoy Red Robin. Be a good guest where ever you go. Speak up before hand to get what you want the way you want. If substitutions can be made good...if not you know ahead of time and can decide whether to stay or leave. Everyone should have an enjoyable dining experience.

I don't know what it is about this particular location but they are SO SLOW! This is the 3rd time that I've been and they sat me right away but after I order it always takes 40+ minutes to get my food. Look it can't take that longer to throw on some extra burger patty's. The food is always good but it just bugs me that it always takes so long to get my food.

I have never had such a bad experience in a Red Robin before. Understaffed, extremely slow, horrible food (cold fries, hard tortilla wrap that was inedible, breaded lemon wedges on salmon burger with rind!) but the worst thing is that it was filthy. Piles of visible trash on floor of the kitchen as I walked by, disgusting bathroom and everything on the table had crusted ketchup on it.

I made an order to go for a not so premium burger and fries. That's it. I paid $15.00 . I opened the box in my car. The box looked like it was thrown out of the window. From the distance I walked from the restaurant to my car, could not have been me to do such damage. My burger sat messy and assembled poorly and my fries were 8 in counting. I'm not going back for such a heavily priced food and no quality control

We came in and there were two families waiting to be seated. The hostess took my name and told me the wait would be about 15 minutes. 15 minutes later they had sat about 6 other parties (including guests who had arrived after us). We were overlooked and so we left and went to Texas Roadhouse and had a great time.

Generally its always awesome! A couple of times I was a bit bummed how small the burgers were however it was made up for the bottomless steak fries! I tell the waiter the sooner they get the fries coming the bigger their tip will be. Great place! Will eat again

Went in to Red Robin for a little bite to eat for lunch. When we got there we were greeted by the host Vince. He said it would be about 20 minutes. After about 35 minutes we were finally called and after following him back at same time as a family that just got there with the same name, he just looked at us surprised and seated them and said we will be soon. We returned to the waiting area for another 14 minutes and were taken to our seats. We first were taken to a booth when we asked to be seated at table originally. The correction was made and we were seated at a table. Our waitress came and took our drink order and when she returned we all started small talk.  Our waitress, Teresa, did an amazing job and really helped us and requested the right entrees for us. We ate and the cod was really tender and good and the Red Robin burger was perfect with the over hard egg and the camp fire sauce for the burger and fries.  By the end of dinner the day was really good and the food was worth it. On the way out the young man Vince made an effort to apologize to the females of our party and what a mistake it was.  This was my first time eating here and the one place I chose going through town and I will come back again. Thank you again Teresa and the staff at Red Robin, YUMMM

I'm disgusted by this 45 minute wait while all the surrounding tables are empty... and they brought my fries before they brought my appetizer (which only came with 8 chips)... also haven't refilled my bottomless fries in the 20 minutes I've been sitting here with an empty basket of fries. I've been keeping track of the time by watching the football game. I've been here since before the kick-off and it's now past half-time and I still don't have my meal. I can go on, if you want, because I have all the time in the world right now...
